key_risks: Regulatory and legal challenges, including a €50 million fine and a €312 million tax dispute
Cybersecurity risks, highlighted by a recent cyberattack in Spain
Labor and operational disruptions, including strikes in South Africa and Europe
Market saturation and intense competition in mature markets
controversies: €50 million fine by CNIL for non-compliant practices in direct marketing and cookie management
€312 million tax dispute with French prosecutors
Labor strikes causing a 47% weekly increase in orange prices in South Africa
environmental_issues: Commitment to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2040, requiring significant investment in renewable energy and energy-efficient technologies
social_issues: Labor disputes and strikes impacting operations and public perception
Cybersecurity incidents potentially eroding customer trust
governance_issues: Regulatory scrutiny and potential reputational damage from non-compliant practices
Ongoing legal and financial liabilities from tax disputes

sources.title: Advertisements inserted among emails: ORANGE fined €50 million
sources.snippet: Background ORANGE provides its customers with an electronic messaging service ("Mail Orange"). Following several investigations, the CNIL found that the company was displaying advertisements in the form of emails among genuine emails in its users' inboxes. sources.title: France: CNIL fines Orange €50 million for unlawfully inserting ...
sources.snippet: On December 10, 2024, the French data protection authority (CNIL) published its Decision SAN-2024-019 of November 14, 2024, in which it sanctioned Orange SA €50 million for violation of the Post and Electronic Communications Code (the Communications Code) and the Act on Data Processing, Data Files, and Individual Liberties (as amended to implement the GDPR) (the Act).

sources.title: Negative Effects of Strikes on the Economy of South Africa - Editology
sources.snippet: Labor strikes can damage a country's reputation and competitiveness in the global market. sources.title: Nefilim Ransomware Attack on Orange SA Exposed Customer Data
sources.snippet: Nefilim ransomware breached the company through its Orange Business Solutions division and added the stolen data to its data leak site on July 15, 2020. The operators published a 339MB archive file titled 'Orange_leak_part1.rar' that contained stolen emails, airplane schematics, and files from 'ATR Aircraft', a French aircraft manufacturer.
